explanation: Only toxdigitvalue needs to be provided. Reason: The MISRA rule in question concerns use of functions from <string.h>. The target function itself contains no calls to any <string.h> functions, so it cannot violate that rule directly. The only callee is toxdigitvalue; its implementation must be inspected to determine whether it (directly or indirectly) calls any <string.h> functions (e.g. strchr, strlen, memcpy, etc.) that could perform out‑of‑bounds accesses of pointer parameters. No other symbols (UINT32_MAX, size_t, uint32_t, etc.) affect whether any <string.h> function is used, so they are not required to decide this specific MISRA rule.
